content:
Currently taking a pass at our realm signup form:
pasted image

I'm tempted to

  • Make everything vertical. E.g. Password and Organization Name look like they should be related in this layout
  • Move all the text to tooltips, or maybe to the right of the input fields. E.g. the Unicode thing is somewhat confusing placed (though probably we should just get rid of that text, and use a sample name like "Wile E. Coyote" with most of the letters replaced with look-alike letters from other alphabets)
  • Remove the last sentence of the Organization Type explanation

Thoughts?

Vertical makes sense to me. I kinda think the user's email and password should be more toward the bottom, especially the password. The password can be the most annoying thing to decide, so it makes sense to have it last, once the user already has invested time. I also think it's sort of logical to have the org stuff first.
Agreed on everything in the first two bullets. I think I prefer to the right (or the left) rather than tooltips.
The explanatory text on "community" is really long. But actually the last sentence feels to me like the essential bit -- it says what the setting actually does.

The "community" decision to me seems definitely suited to a tooltip. I kind of thing folks will be on either extreme for this--some folks will just pick the obvious choice for them, and others will want to make a careful decision and be willing to open the tooltip.

One style that explanation could go in that I think works well in some settings forms: just describe the consequences as fact (and then when the user changes the setting, the description changes.) Like

Organization admins won't have access to take over other users' accounts or see their private messages. Good for open source projects, social groups, and volunteer organizations.
Yeah, I've definitely seen the style @Greg Price talks about, and it has a no-nonsense, professional feel to me that I like.

And then for the other side something like

Organization admins will be able to control other users' accounts and look at their private messages. Good for corporate IT environments.
Usually when I see that style (I'm visualizing something like the macOS System Preferences app here) the description is visible as part of the panel, not a tooltip.

I think I agree with most of what's been said here. I definitely favor the 1-column approach (we could also consider a much more JS-heavy form where 1 question is asked at a time, which seems to be the style for slick signup forms in 2017).
It would be helpful if the description of the short name field included that it needs to be all lowercase.
Good idea; can you open an issue @Andrea Longo ?
Thanks! There's a bunch of similar hiccups on that page that the onboarding team will work on soon -- if you see any feel free to just let me know, or open an issue and @-mention me.

I changed the realm short name description.
